benefits.name: Alaska National Guard Tuition Assistance
benefits.description: Alaska National Guard provides 100% tuition and fees coverage at all University of Alaska System schools (Fairbanks, Anchorage, Southeast). Members can combine both federal and state TA for 100% coverage. Army Guard: $250/credit hour (exhaust federal TA first), Air Guard: 100% tuition up to 12 credits/semester after Tech School. One credential per level (certificate, associate, bachelor's, master's).
benefits.eligibility: Active Alaska National Guard members in good standing, satisfactory unit training participation
benefits.value: 100% tuition + fees at University of Alaska System, can stack with federal TA

benefits.name: In-State Tuition for Military
benefits.description: Active duty service members, Guard, and Reserve stationed in Alaska for 12+ consecutive months, plus their dependents, qualify for resident tuition rates at all Alaska institutions. Can retain this rate while stationed in Alaska regardless of home state residency. Tuition capped at $250/credit for active duty.
benefits.eligibility: Active duty/Guard/Reserve stationed in Alaska 12+ months, or their dependents
benefits.value: $250/credit tuition cap + resident rates

benefits.name: Property Tax Exemption for Disabled Veterans
benefits.description: Veterans with 50%+ service-connected disability rating receive exemption from property taxes on first $150,000 of assessed value on their primary residence. Exemption transfers to surviving spouse age 60+ upon veteran's death. Must qualify for or be eligible for Permanent Fund Dividend. Requires annual application with disability rating letter.
benefits.eligibility: 50%+ service-connected disability, primary residence, permanent place of abode, PFD eligible
benefits.value: Tax exempt on first $150K assessed value

benefits.name: Alaska Permanent Fund Dividend (PFD)
benefits.description: All Alaska residents receive annual dividend from state's oil revenue investment fund. 2024 dividend was $1,702 per person. Application period is January 1 - March 31 each year. Must be Alaska resident for entire prior calendar year and intend to remain indefinitely. Active duty stationed in Alaska qualify with special residency rules.
benefits.eligibility: Alaska residents (including active duty stationed in Alaska with special provisions)
benefits.value: $1,702/person (2024 amount, varies yearly)

benefits.name: No State Income Tax
benefits.description: Alaska has no state income tax on individuals. This means military pay, military retirement pay, VA disability compensation, TSP distributions, and survivor benefits are all untaxed at the state level. No state tax return required.
benefits.eligibility: All Alaska residents
benefits.value: 0% state tax on all income

benefits.name: Veterans Land Purchase Discount
benefits.description: Alaska resident veterans receive one-time 25% discount on purchase of state land (residential/recreational, not commercial/industrial). Discount applies to purchase price minus reimbursable costs (survey, road development). Must be Alaska resident for 1+ year immediately preceding sale. Each parcel webpage shows estimated discount amount.
benefits.eligibility: 90+ days active duty (or early separation), honorable discharge, Alaska resident 1+ year, 18+ years old
benefits.value: 25% discount on state land purchase price (once-in-lifetime)

benefits.name: Veterans Mortgage Interest Rate Preference
benefits.description: Alaska Housing Finance Corporation (AHFC) offers veterans 1% lower interest rate on first $50,000 of home purchase loan. Veterans Mortgage program also provides financing at lower interest rates. Contact AHFC-approved lender to implement.
benefits.eligibility: Qualified veterans purchasing home in Alaska
benefits.value: 1% interest rate reduction on first $50K of loan

benefits.name: State Employment Veteran Preference
benefits.description: Five-point veteran preference for all open competitive state job vacancies. If numerical ratings used, veterans receive 5% of points. Disabled veterans and POWs guaranteed interview opportunity. Qualified means meets minimum qualifications and requires review of application.
benefits.eligibility: 181+ days active duty with honorable discharge (or less with campaign medal/Purple Heart/heroism medal), current Alaska Guard members, POWs
benefits.value: 5 points preference + disabled/POW interview guarantee

benefits.name: Priority of Service Employment Programs
benefits.description: Alaska Department of Labor provides priority of service for veterans, eligible spouses, and caregivers seeking employment, apprenticeships, and on-the-job training. Specialized DVOP and LVER staff at Anchorage, Fairbanks, and Matanuska-Susitna job centers provide comprehensive assessments, career services, job counseling, resume assistance. Jobs for Veterans State Grant: $586,077 (FFY 2025).
benefits.eligibility: Veterans with honorable discharge, eligible spouses and caregivers, veterans with significant barriers to employment
benefits.value: Free comprehensive career services + priority job referrals

benefits.name: Occupational Licensing for Military
benefits.description: Deployed service members can defer professional licensing requirements until after redeployment (combat zones/hazardous duty). Request online via myAlaska or submit exemption form. Military Family Life Counselors receive expedited application processing for professional counselor, social worker, and qualifying licenses. Temporary licenses available for most license types (valid 180 days).
benefits.eligibility: Deployed service members with Alaska professional license, DoD MFLCs, active duty with Alaska orders, military spouses with Alaska orders
benefits.value: Licensing deferral during deployment + expedited processing + 180-day temporary licenses

benefits.name: Free Hunting & Fishing - Disabled Veterans
benefits.description: Alaska resident disabled veterans with 50%+ service-connected disability receive FREE lifetime permanent identification card for hunting, sport fishing, and trapping. No king salmon stamp or state conservation stamp required. Must be physically present in Alaska to apply. Includes Alaska Territorial Guard members with 50%+ disability.
benefits.eligibility: 50%+ service-connected disability, honorable discharge, Alaska resident 12+ months
benefits.value: FREE lifetime hunting, fishing, trapping (no stamps required)

benefits.name: Free Hunting & Fishing - Guard & Reserves
benefits.description: Active Alaska National Guard members and U.S. Armed Forces Reserve members receive FREE annual hunting, trapping, and sport fishing license. Must meet Alaska residency requirements. No king salmon stamp or state conservation stamp required.
benefits.eligibility: Active Alaska National Guard or U.S. Armed Forces Reserve members, Alaska residents
benefits.value: FREE annual hunting, fishing, trapping license

benefits.name: Free Hunting & Fishing - Seniors
benefits.description: Alaska residents age 60+ receive FREE lifetime permanent identification card for hunting, sport fishing, and trapping. No king salmon stamp or state conservation stamp required. Must be physically present in Alaska to apply.
benefits.eligibility: Alaska residents 60+ years old
benefits.value: FREE lifetime hunting, fishing, trapping

benefits.name: Reduced Hunting & Fishing - Active Duty
benefits.description: Active duty stationed in Alaska 12+ months can purchase resident licenses (no guide required). Active duty stationed less than 12 months receive special military license at resident rates. Nonresident military pay reduced prices. Active duty on leave outside U.S. exempt from hunter safety requirements.
benefits.eligibility: Active duty service members stationed in or on leave from Alaska
benefits.value: Resident rates or reduced nonresident rates

benefits.name: Free State Park Camping Pass
benefits.description: Disabled veterans receive one FREE Alaska State Park Camping Pass valid in all developed Alaska State Park campgrounds. Pass is good for 2 years. Must present proof of service-connected disability in person at Anchorage or Fairbanks Department of Natural Resources Public Information Centers. Does not include boat launch or day use.
benefits.eligibility: Disabled veterans with service-connected disability
benefits.value: FREE 2-year state park camping pass (all developed campgrounds)

benefits.name: Alaska Marine Highway Reduced Fare
benefits.description: Veterans with service-connected disability receive 50% reduced passenger fare on Alaska Marine Highway System (AMHS) vessels. Attendant (if required by physician) also travels at half fare. Valid for all AMHS ferry routes statewide.
benefits.eligibility: Veterans with service-connected disability (attendant if physician-required)
benefits.value: 50% fare reduction for veteran + attendant

benefits.name: Alaska Railroad Military Discount
benefits.description: Active duty service members, military retirees, and their dependents receive 20% discount on Alaska Railroad tickets. Must show military ID or proof of status at boarding. Valid for all Alaska Railroad routes.
benefits.eligibility: Active duty, military retirees, dependents
benefits.value: 20% discount on train tickets

benefits.name: Free Specialty License Plates
benefits.description: Alaska offers FREE specialty license plates (after validation of service/loss) for: Purple Heart recipients, Prisoners of War (POW), Pearl Harbor survivors, and Gold Star Families. Plates display branch of service plus 64 different unit symbols/badges available.
benefits.eligibility: Purple Heart recipients, POWs, Pearl Harbor survivors, Gold Star immediate family (DD1300 required)
benefits.value: FREE specialty plates (one-time validation)

benefits.name: Veteran Service License Plates
benefits.description: Veterans who served in U.S. Armed Forces or Alaska National Guard members qualify for specialty plates showing branch of service. $30 plate fee at initial application or replacement. Plates indicate branch and can include unit symbols.
benefits.eligibility: Veterans with honorable service, current Alaska National Guard members
benefits.value: $30 one-time fee for service plates

benefits.name: Disabled Veteran License Plates
benefits.description: Veterans with 50%+ service-connected disability receive disabled veteran plate exempt from Motor Vehicle Registration Taxes and registration fees for one vehicle. Optional wheelchair logo version with parking privileges (requires Form 861). Second and subsequent plates available at full fees.
benefits.eligibility: 50%+ service-connected disability, VA certification required
benefits.value: FREE registration (no taxes/fees) for one vehicle

benefits.name: Veteran Driver's License Designation
benefits.description: Veterans entitled to have veteran status noted on Alaska Driver's License or ID Card. Cost is $5 at Alaska DMV. Proof of honorable discharge required (DD214 or equivalent).
benefits.eligibility: Veterans with honorable discharge
benefits.value: $5 fee for veteran designation on DL/ID

benefits.name: Military Driver's License Extension
benefits.description: Non-commercial driver's license valid for 90 days after discharge or return to Alaska, whichever occurs first (policy adopted June 1997). Provides transition period for veterans returning to Alaska.
benefits.eligibility: Military members with Alaska driver's license
benefits.value: 90-day license validity extension

benefits.name: CDL Road Skills Testing Waiver
benefits.description: Alaska offers Commercial Driver's License (CDL) road skills testing waiver for service members and former service members based on military driving experience. Reduces barriers to commercial employment for veterans.
benefits.eligibility: Service members and veterans with qualifying military driving experience
benefits.value: Waiver of CDL road skills test requirement

benefits.name: Alaska Veterans & Pioneers Home
benefits.description: State-operated long-term care facility in Palmer providing assisted living, memory care, and skilled nursing. Eden Alternative Registered Home offering compassionate care with focus on quality of life. Qualifying veterans eligible for VA per diem to offset costs. Features include activities, communal dining, 12-16 hour nursing, 24-hour supervision.
benefits.eligibility: Alaska resident 1+ year prior to admission, veterans may receive VA per diem assistance
benefits.value: Affordable long-term care ($5,000-$7,300/month estimated) + VA per diem for qualifying veterans

benefits.name: Free DD-214 Recording
benefits.description: Veterans may record original or certified copy of Armed Forces Report of Separation (DD214) without fee at any State Recorder's office of Department of Natural Resources. 14 district offices statewide oversee 34 recording districts. Creates official public record.
benefits.eligibility: All veterans with DD214
benefits.value: FREE recording of DD214 in official state records

benefits.name: WWII Veterans High School Diploma
benefits.description: Alaska Department of Education awards high school diplomas to WWII veterans (including Alaska Territorial Guard members) who served August 7, 1940 - July 25, 1947. Veterans with GED may also apply. Family members may apply for eligible deceased or incapacitated veterans. Diploma shows veteran's full name.
benefits.eligibility: WWII veterans (or family of deceased/incapacitated) who served 8/7/1940-7/25/1947
benefits.value: FREE Alaska high school diploma for WWII service

benefits.name: Purple Star School Designation
benefits.description: Alaska Purple Star School designation recognizes schools that show major commitment to students and families connected to nation's military. Helps military families identify supportive schools when relocating to Alaska. Schools must meet criteria demonstrating military-friendly environment.
benefits.eligibility: Alaska schools meeting military-friendly criteria
benefits.value: Recognition of military-supportive school environment

benefits.name: Fort Richardson National Cemetery
benefits.description: VA National Cemetery in Fort Richardson (near Anchorage) following National Cemetery Association rules. Eligible for burial: veterans with honorable discharge meeting minimum active duty requirement, spouses, widow/widowers, minor dependents, certain disabled unmarried adult children. Spouses/children who predecease veteran also eligible. Reserve members who die on duty or eligible for retirement pay also eligible.
benefits.eligibility: Eligible veterans, spouses, dependents per VA national cemetery rules
benefits.value: FREE burial in national cemetery

benefits.name: Military Service Credit Toward State Retirement
benefits.description: Veterans can receive credit for military service toward Alaska state retirement system. Helps veterans who become state employees receive retirement benefits sooner based on prior military service. Contact Alaska Division of Retirement and Benefits for specifics.
benefits.eligibility: Veterans who become Alaska state employees
benefits.value: Military service time credited toward state retirement

benefits.name: Hilton Honors Military Employment Program
benefits.description: Veterans, transitioning service members, National Guard/Reservists, and military spouses registered at Alaska Job Center can receive up to 100,000 Hilton Honors points (once-in-lifetime) for approved job-search activities including interviews, relocation, or training for new position. Must have current Hilton Honors account and specific employment-related travel need.
benefits.eligibility: Veterans, transitioning service members, Guard/Reserve, military spouses registered at Alaska Job Center
benefits.value: Up to 100,000 Hilton Honors points (once-in-lifetime)

benefits.name: Governor's Veterans Advocacy Award
benefits.description: Annual award presented on Veterans Day (November 11) recognizing individuals demonstrating extraordinary personal concern, compassion, and commitment to veterans' causes, veterans, and their families. May include those who formed innovative volunteer programs/projects benefiting veterans. Must be performed on volunteer basis.
benefits.eligibility: Individuals with exceptional volunteer service to Alaska veterans
benefits.value: Annual recognition by Governor of Alaska
